Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. \nThe girls say yes to khadi at Kochi\n.description: Khadi took centerstage recently, as young girls dressed themselves up in designer attire made of khadi and walked the ramp in style, at the St Teresa’s College. The event, which aimed at promoting the use of indigenous materials and exploring its immense possibilities, was an eye-opener as to how khadi can be fashionable. Brain dead woman\u2019s organs donated.description: KOCHI: Nibeya Joseph, a 25-year-old nurse, gave a new lease of life to six persons after her family decided to donate her organs. Nibeya was declared brain dead at Aster Medcity on Friday. Nibeya along with her brother Nikhil Joseph was admitted at the hospital on Monday after they suffered critical injuries in a road accident. Her heart and one kidney were transplanted into patients admitted at Kottayam Medical College. While liver was transplanted into a patient at Aster Medcity, pancreas and the other kidney were donated to patients at Amrita Institute of Medical Sciences. The cornea was donated to Giridhar Eye Institute. All the recipients were selected from the patients registered with the Kerala Network for Organ Sharing (KNOS) Mrithasanjeevani. Missing cop traced to Tamil Nadu, brough.description: KOCHI: After a nail-biting wait that lasted 44 hours, Kochi central CI VS Navas – who abruptly disappeared around 6am on Thursday reportedly after a heated exchange with a senior officer on the previous night – was traced to Karur in Tamil Nadu early on Saturday. Navas, who went incommunicado after he sent a WhatsApp message to his wife that he was going on a journey, later apologized for the grief caused by his disappearance on Facebook. His post – accessible only to his friends – reads: I apologize for causing grief. I went on a journey seeking some peace when I was on the verge of losing my mind. Now, am coming back. Sunil Kumar – an RPF (Railway Protection Force) officer from Idukki posted at Madurai – identified him around 2am at Madurai railway station. This was after he approached RPF seeking their help to reach Coimbatore. After RPF officers had sent him on Nagercoil-Coimbatore express, Kumar checked his WhatsApp and found that Navas was reported missing. He then rang an officer he knew from Idukki and gave them precise information about Navas. This was possible as RPF had given him a seat in a relatively-less crowded compartment. Soon, Tamil Nadu RPF was alerted around 3am and Navas was found at Karur. “His photograph was immediately sent to TN team. A police team from Palakkad reached Madurai to pick him up. Another team from Ernakulam awaited him at Palakkad and brought him to Kochi,” said a senior officer. He was presented before a magistrate and later allowed to go home. Commissioner Vijay Sakhare said the reason for his disappearance will be probed. Sources said Navas had told his friends that he went to Rameswaram to meet a friend. South police had registered a man missing case after recording his wife’s statement on Thursday. Meanwhile, opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala said that unscientific reforms have increased the workload and pressure on policemen, leading to man missing incidents. He said the resignation of CPO Ratheesh, deployed at AR Camp in Kannur, points to a similar issue. The entire police system in state lacks proper leadership. The chief minister, who holds the home portfolio, has lost control over the force, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Paternal grandad gets custody of younger.description: Idukki: Idukki district child welfare committee (CWC) on Monday handed over the custody of the younger brother of the seven-year-old boy, who died after being brutally up by his mother’s lover, to his paternal grandfather for next two months. Recently, the child’s maternal grandmother had filed a habeas corpus petition before the high court seeking custody of the boy. The court had then ordered to produce the child before the CWC. Chairman of CWC, Idukki, Joseph Augustine said, “The child was produced before CWC as per the direction of the court. The health condition of the boy is stable. CWC has directed Thiruvanthapuram medical college hospital’s child psychiatry wing assistant professor Dr Jayaprakash to examine the kid and submit a report. We will take further steps on the basis of the report.” “We have directed the parental grandfather to ensure that the maternal grandmother could visit the kid,” added Augustine. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Kochi Metro completes two years today.description: KOCHI: Kochi Metro has a total ridership of 2.58 crore since Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the rail service on June17, 2017. While the average ridership per day in the Metro is 40,000, it goes up to 45,000 during weekends. The Metro has garnered Rs 150.24 crore in revenue in the last two years. A total of 45,000 people have Metro’s Kochi 1 card; but only 26% of cardholders use the Metro daily. Kochi Metro officials said the extension work on the stretch between Maharaja’s College ground and Thykoodam is set to be completed by August 2019. The state government is waiting to get the final approval from the central government to start extension work from JLN Stadium to Kakkanad. “We have got inprinciple approval from Centre in February for the Kaloor-Kakkanad stretch. But the final approval is awaited. There was a delay due to the general elections in April. We expect the final approval to come within a month,” said Kochi Metro Rail Ltd managing director MohammedHanish. The foundation for the Metro was laid in 2012 and construction commenced in 2013. Modi inaugurated the first part from Aluva to Palarivattom. The second part from Palarivattom to Maharaja’s College was started on October 3 same year. The minimum fare is Rs 10. The construction of water Metro projects will start this year itself. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Fans cheer for actor, disrupt CM Vijayan.description: PALAKKAD: Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan cut short his inaugural address at the opening of a hospital here on Sunday, following the clamour by a bunch of Mohanlal fans. The chief minister and the actor shared the dais during the inauguration of Avitis Institute of Medical Sciences at Nemmara here. The fans started cheering the actor as soon as he entered along with the CM. The uproar continued even as the CM started addressing the gathering. A visibly irked Vijayan said, “Those who are cheering the actor lives in their own world. They do not know any other things. This may be because they are immature. But they are not doing a service to the actor either.” Before concluding his speech, the chief minister said, “Considering the progress the state has achieved, it does not have enough specialized medical facilities. We (the government) have been requesting the central government to sanction an All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS) for long, to meet the increasing demands in Kerala.” He added that he had met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Saturday and urged him to accord the sanction for AIIMS in Kerala. “The Central government is expected to consider Kerala’s demand,” the CM said. He also added that the opening of Avitis Institute of Medical Sciences with super specialty departments in cardiology, neurology, nephrology, gastroenteritis, renal science etc, was a big step forward in the health sector in the state. The function was presided over by assembly speaker P Sreeramakrishnan. Health minister K.K. Shailaja, agriculture minister V S Sunil Kumar, water resources minister K Krishnankutty, MLA s O Rajagopal and K Babu, MPs V K Sreekantan and Remya Haridas, UAE Exchange founder chairman B R Shetty among others were present. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. \u2018White-topping can save Kochi roads.description: KOCHI: The municipal corporation has failed to adopt a technology recommended by the Indian Road Congress (IRC) that may help roads to extend their life and reduce the financial burden. “Whitetopping of roads under the corporation would be the cheapest possible way to give longevity to city roads which crumble with the first monsoon shower,” said former mayor J Sohan. Whitetopping can be done in various ways — from ultra-thin to thin and thick. Among them, ultra-thin whitetopping (UWT), in which a concrete overlay of 50mm to 100mm thickness with closely spaced joints is bonded to an existing bituminous pavement, is the most widely used. It consists of a thin layer of fibre-reinforced concrete placed over a clean, chipped surface of bituminous concrete pavement, to achieve full or partial bonding. Though the corporation and the PWD had experimented with the technology earlier, it has not been widely adopted. In 2016, PWD had whitetopped a five-and-a-half kilometre stretch of road between HMT Junction and Manalimukku. “It was also one of the major recommendations of the Kochi Road Conclave organized by the Kochi corporation in 2011,” said Sohan. The conclave had recommended whitetopping of all existing roads under the corporation, developing designer roads and the use of bitumen macadam and bitumen concrete (BMBC) in roads with high traffic density. “Whitetopping has been done successfully in several states across India including Gujarat. It is high time that we adopted it. It acts like waterproofing and can reduce damage due to seeping in of water during the rains,” said Sohan. Whitetopping can uniformly fill pores in bituminous pavements more effectively and thus help reduce the occurrence of cracks. “It is also cost-effective,” he said. Apart from IRC, Cement Manufacturers Association has also recommended it. The technology offers long life, low maintenance and low life-cycle cost apart from improved safety and environmental benefits. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Contribution to family brought him spl h.description: Alappuzha: On Father’s Day, villagers of Mannancherry honoured an 85-year-old man, who made all his nine children, their better halves and his grandchildren government employees through his support and encouragement. All of them are now working in over 20 government offices across the state. Alappuzha sub-collector Krishna Teja honoured Mohammed Kunju at a function organized by the villagers at his residence at Adivaram here on Sunday. This octogenarian said: “My father died when I was a boy and I started to work in a shop. I starved for many days due to financial constraints. So, when I married Ishabeevi, I told her that I won’t allow my children to face the hardships I faced. We have eight sons and a daughter. We decided to make all of them government employees. My wife and I worked hard and created ambience for my nine children for studying and becoming government employees. Understanding our hard work and pain, all of them studied well and secured government jobs. When our sons got married, we encouraged our daughters-in-law to dream big and arranged facilities at our home for them to prepare for PSC examinations. Now, my family consists of officials working in various departments like revenue, education, health, motor vehicle, state water transport, agriculture, Khadi, forest and bank. My grandchildren, who completed their education, also got government jobs. I am very happy now,” he said. The only pain of Kunju is that his wife is not there to share this happiness. “She died at the age of 65 twelve years ago due to age-related ailments. My elder son Hamsakutty also died at the age of 45 due to liver disease. He was the head clerk with district medical office. His wife is working as manager at Alappuzha district cooperative bank. Hamsakutty’s two children Habis and Anas are also working in health department. I have only one message to all. If you are ready to work hard with dedication, you will reach your goal one day,” he said. The programme was organized by Aranghu social forum spearheaded by social worker C P Shaji. Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. In Video:Indian Army’s vehicle attacked by IED in J&K’s PulwamaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha poll results reflect believers.description: KOTTAYAM: The NSS leadership, which had not yet expressed its opinion about the Lok Sabha election results, has come out with its view in the editorial of the latest edition of Services, the mouthpiece of NSS. The editorial said that the election results was a setback for those who hurt the feelings of believers. The results in the state reflect the protest of the faithful against the LDF government for failing to protect their faith and also against the Central government, which failed to resolve the issue. The result was the reaction of believers, irrespective of caste and religion, for insulting Lord Ayyappa. The Constitution assures freedom for religious faith and related activities. Governments are bound to protect freedom of religion and faith. The state-central governments should realize that there was no relevance for political stance in such situations. The editorial also said that even the NDA was shocked by the victory of the Congress-led UDF. The defeat in Alappuzha, the lone seat which the UDF lost, was due to some differences in the front in that constituency, it said. The editorial also said that the thumping win of the NDA in pther parts of the country was due to the front's election tactics. The Congress and its allies failed to foresee it., it said. Removal of name from voters\u2019 list w.description: Kochi: It is illegal to remove a voter from the voters list without giving him an opportunity of hearing, the high court has said. Inaction by the voter in getting his name restored also won’t justify such action, the court said. The judgment by Justice Shaji P Chaly came after considering a petition filed by 64-year-old A Subair of Chala in Thiruvananthapuram, questioning the removal of his name from the voters’ list prepared for the Lok Sabha elections this year. Names of his wife and daughter were retained while his was removed on the report of booth level officer that he changed his residence. Referring to Section 22 of the Representation of the People Act of 1950, the court pointed out that the statute says the voter should be given a reasonable opportunity of being heard. The judgment said, “On an evaluation of the said provisions, it is explicit that, they are peremptory in nature and can never be brushed aside or overlooked. Proviso thereto makes it clear that before removing a person from the voters list, the electoral registration officer is duty bound to give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard in respect of the action proposed to be taken. Which thus also means, the action or enquiry contemplated under Sec 22 of the Act, 1950 is not an empty formality, but on the other hand, founded on principles of natural justice, which if violated, action becomes arbitrary and illegal inviting action against the officer concerned.” No opportunity of hearing was given to the petitioner in the case, the court added. The Election Commission had contended that the removal from voters’ list was preceded by several steps such as inviting objections to draft electoral roll, including giving publicity to ‘deleted lists’ and that a final electoral roll was published at the end of a process that lasted over a year. After finding that no opportunity of hearing was granted to the petitioner, the court said, “It is also apposite to mention that, mere inaction on the part of the petitioner to restore the name removed from the voters list, is not a justification for removing the name, otherwise than in accordance with law.” The court then ordered the chief election commissioner of Kerala to conduct a detailed inquiry into the incident and, if required, take appropriate action against the officers who removed the petitioner’s name from the voters list within two weeks. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. Slain cop\u2019s mom, son say Ajas threa.description: ALAPPUZHA: The body of civil police officer Soumya Pushpakaran, who was brutally murdered, was handed over to her kin after completing legal and medical examinations at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital at 2pm on Sunday. It has been shifted to the morgue of a private hospital at her native place, Oachira in Kollam. Cremation would take place after the arrival of her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, on Tuesday, said police. Soumya , who was working at Vallikunnam police station, was hacked and set ablaze by N A Ajas (33), a civil police officer attached to Aluva traffic police station, on Saturday near her home at Thekkemuri in Vallikunnam grama panchayat. Soumya was working at Vallikunnam police stationAjas, who sustained over 40% burns, has been admitted to Alappuzha Medical College Hospital. Though police arrived at the hospital with magistrate to record his on Saturday night, he was not able to speak. The police have not registered his arrest still Sunday evening. Meanwhile, Soumya’s mother Indira and elder son Rishikesh told media that Ajas had threatened and attacked her many times.  “Amma (Soumya) had told me if anything happens to her, I should tell police that Ajas is responsible. She told me that the man had threatened her several times over phone. My father is unaware of these incidents,’’ Rishikesh said. According to Indira, “Ajas killed her after she turned down his marriage proposal. He had threatened to kill her and her husband many times. He had beaten her up with shoes. When I had offered to interfere, she said it might create more trouble. She had also informed Vallikunnam sub-inspector about the issue three months ago.” However, Vallikunnam sub-inspector Shaiju Ebrahim said he was not informed. He added that Indira herself told him on Sunday that they did not inform police due to fear. He said Sowmya had borrowed Rs 1.25 lakh from Ajas. When she returned the money, Ajas did not accept it and demanded to marry him. She transferred the money to his account. But he sent it back to her account. Following this, Sowmya and Indira asked him to collect the money in person at KSRTC bus station, Ernakulam in May. Though he came to meet them, he refused to take the money back and dropped the duo at Clappana. When things started going out of hands, Sowmya blocked his number. But Ajas continued to stalk her from other numbers. Indira, too, had requested Ajas not to disturb her daughter, the officer said. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Her husband was home a month ago on vacation. Apart from Rishikesh (Class VII), the couple has another son, Adhisesh (Class V) and a three-and-a-half-year-old daughter, Ridhika. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Soumya murder: Magistrate records statem.description: ALAPPUZHA: Alappuzha judicial first class magistrate has recorded the statement of civil police officer (CPO) N A Ajas, who brutally murdered woman CPO Soumya Pushpakaran by setting her ablaze. The magistrate recorded his statement after Ajas told the doctor that he can speak to the magistrate on Sunday. “Ajas is undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital and his burn injuries are serious. The burn injuries have affected the functioning of kidneys. The doctors started dialysis on Monday,” police said. However, Vallikunnam police are yet to register his arrest. According to police sources, Ajas said that he killed Soumya after she refused to marry him and she kept a distance from him. Meanwhile, Soumya’s relatives said that her cremation will be held by Wednesday noon. Her body is kept in the morgue of a private hospital at her native place at Oachira in Kollam. Her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, will reach home by Wednesday morning, a relative said. However, another relative of Soumya said that some MGNREGA workers who were at work near Soumya’s home had told them that it was not just Ajas in the car. “They told us that one more person was inside the car and he ran away when Ajas alighted from the vehicle. We have informed police about this and the police said that they need to check the CCTV footage to confirm it,” he said. Ajas, who was waiting in a rented car, in front of Soumya’s home, rammed her scooter and knocked her down on Saturday. Seeing Ajas alight from the car, Soumya tried to flee but Ajas attacked her with a sword. Soumya managed to run to a neighbour’s house after crossing a small canal. Ajas chased her, poured petrol over her body and set her on fire using a cigarette lighter. Soumya was the younger daughter of Pushpakaran and Indira of Clappana in Kollam. Pushpakaran, 67, suffered stroke four years ago and is now not able to go for work. Indira, a tailor by profession, met the study expenses of Soumya, a graduate, and her elder sister. Soumya’s elder sister and family live in Abu Dhabi. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Fisheries sector looks at sustainable bo.description: KOCHI: The newly amended Kerala Marine Fisheries Regulation Act (KMFRA) is the first in the country that will address the carbon emission concerns from the mechanized and motorized fishing sector. There are more than 21,500 marine fishing vessels operating in the Kerala waters, of which more than 4,000 vessels are mechanized and another 11,000 accounts for motorized vessels. Studies by the Central Institute of Fisheries Technology have shown that energy efficient fishing systems including changes in the vessels, engine horsepower, gear and operations could reduce the carbon emissions. Fisheries scientists who have been working on sustainable fishing technology said that vessel design, construction and operation fishing gear and methods, adoption of advanced technology and fleet management conservation, management and enhancement of resources were the key. “Across the world studies have calculated the carbon footprint of major fish harvesting systems like trawling, purse seining, gillnetting and long lining. For example, in trawling, the global warming potential is 5.43 per kilo of fish caught,” said Leela Edwin, head, department of fishing technology, CIFT. According to a series of studies by the CIFT scientists including Leela Edwin, Dhiju Das and Renju Ravi under a project on green fishing systems for tropical seas, fisheries in India consume as much as 1378.8 million litres of fuel and releases 3.13 million tonnes of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere every year. The energy use in fishing begins from going to and from the fishing ground, dropping the nets, the fishing method, processing and transporting to consumer and this was calculated under the life cycle assessment of the individual fishing units. “CIFT has worked with the Kerala government to fix optimum limits for boat engines and fishing gears. This along with other standards for the materials will ensure that we will be able to reduce the energy consumption in the fisheries sector. This will help in the usage of sustainable gear for the fishing sector and this is now being implemented in this sector,” Leela Edwin said. Fishing vessel hull optimization, reduction of engine rpm, periodic maintenance of hull and replacement of two-stroke petrol engine to the inboard diesel engine is recommended to reduce the environmental impact related to the fishing operation. Use of high durable alternative webbing materials and appropriate use of lead sinkers will increase the life of gear and reduce environmental impacts. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Tourist drowns at Anakkulam.description: Idukki: A tourist drowned in the Anakkulam river near Mankulam in the district on Sunday. The deceased has been identified as Midhun Krishna (23) of Peringamala in Thiruvananthapuram. Police said the incident occurred around 2pm when four tourists were bathing in the river near Valiyaparakkutty. Along with Krishna, another member of the gang Sanu also fell into deep water. Though the other two, Akhil and Jyothish, rushed to the spot, they could rescue only Sanu. “The local residents later recovered Krishna. Though he was rushed to a private hospital, doctors declared him brought dead. The body was shifted to Adimali taluk hospital for postmortem. Krishna was an employee at the casualty wing of Kolenchery medical college. The four-member team reached Mankulam on Saturday,” said police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Lost votes: Removal from voters list wit.description: KOCHI: It is illegal to remove a voter from the voters list without giving him an opportunity of hearing, says the Kerala high court. Inaction by the voter in getting his name restored also won’t justify such action, the court said. The judgment by justice Shaji P Chaly was after considering a petition (WP-C No. 13684/2019) filed by 64-year-old A Subair of Chala in Thiruvananthapuram questioning removal of his name from the voters list prepared for the Lok Sabha Elections this year. Names of his wife and daughter were retained while his was removed on the report of booth level officer that he changed his residence. Referring to section 22 of Representation of the People Act of 1950, the court pointed out that the statute says the voter should be given a reasonable opportunity of being heard. The judgment said, “On an evaluation of the said provisions, it is explicit that, they are peremptory in nature and can never be brushed aside or overlooked. Proviso thereto makes it clear that before removing a person from the voters list, the electoral registration officer is duty bound to give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard in respect of the action proposed to be taken. Which thus also means, the action or enquiry contemplated under Sec.22 of the Act, 1950 is not an empty formality, but on the other hand, founded on principles of natural justice, which if violated, action becomes arbitrary and illegal inviting action against the officer concerned.” No opportunity of hearing was given to the petitioner in the case, the court added. The Election Commission had contended that the removal from voters list was preceded by several steps such as inviting objections to draft electoral roll, including giving publicity to ‘Deleted Lists’ and that a final electoral roll was published at the end of a process that lasted over a year. After finding that no opportunity of hearing was granted to the petitioner, the court said, “It is also apposite to mention that, mere inaction on the part of the petitioner to restore the name removed from the voters list, is not a justification for removing the name, otherwise than in accordance with law.” The court then ordered the chief election commissioner of Kerala to conduct a detailed enquiry into the incident and, if required, take appropriate action against the officers who removed the petitioner’s name from the voters list within two weeks. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Corruption will not be tolerated at any.description: Palakkad: Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said that the LDF government would not tolerate corruption in the state. “If corruption is found anywhere strict action will be taken and the government will give all support to end corruption,” Vijayan said. Inaugurating the new office complex of the district vigilance & anti-corruption bureau (VACB) here on Sunday, the chief minister said the government had given a free hand for the vigilance to function independently. “Government will not interfere in their work,” he added. He said more officials would be appointed to make the work of vigilance more effective. “The cases charged by vigilance are handled very seriously and they are also given the legal support in conducting cases against corruption. Government has taken into account the general feeling of people against corruption in the state,” the CM said. The first phase of the 14,000 sq ft building was completed at a cost of Rs 1.73 crore and the second and third phase works will start soon. The event was presided over by minister for welfare of scheduled caste and scheduled tribes A K Balan. The keynote address was delivered by minister for water resources K Krishnankutty. It was attended by V K Sreekantan, MP-elect; Shafi Parambil, MLA, district panchayat president K Santhakumari; ADGP and VACB director K Karthi; district collector D Balamurali among others. HC transfers trial to Ekm CBI court.description: Kochi: The high court has ordered for transferring the trial in the case over murder of Muslim League worker Abdul Shukkoor to the CBI special court in Ernakulam. A petition filed by CBI seeking transfer of trial and further proceedings to the special court here was considered by the high court. Transferring of the case pending before Thalassery sessions court is needed so that the additional report filed in the case can also be considered by the trial court, CBI had argued. CBI approached the HC after the Thalassery court declined to accept its report and asked it to approach the special court in Ernakulam. The HC had earlier stayed further proceedings in the case at Thalassery sessions court. It was on February 20, 2012 that Shukkoor was murdered in broad daylight at Ariyil near Pattuvam in Kannur. This was allegedly in retaliation of workers of Muslim League’s youth wing blocking vehicles of CPM leaders. Prosecution had then informed that a proper probe could not be conducted due to intimidatory tactics played by the party to which the leaders belong. In the chargesheet filed in February, CBI had named CPM leaders P Jayarajan and T V Rajesh to be involved in the conspiracy. A single bench of the high court had in February 2016 ordered CBI to conduct a further investigation in the case after considering a plea by the victim’s mother. Chellanam residents protest by locking p.description: KOCHI: Irked by the frequent sea erosion and authorities’ failure in finding comprehensive solution to the issue, Chellanam residents staged a protest at the panchayat office after locking the office from outside on Monday. More than 800 protesters staged a dharna in front of the office demanding a comprehensive solution to the problems caused by sea erosion. Even though the panchayat officials waited till 2pm to enter the office, the protesters did not let them in. Following this, the officials had to return and the office remained shut for the rest of the day even after the protesters dispersed. According to Kannamali police, around 700 people marched from Velankanni church to the office around 10am but were blocked by the police before they could enter the office compound. But the protesters, who anticipated the police move, had sent around 50 women to the office around 8am and they locked the office’s main door from outside. The protest led by West Kochi Theera Samrakshana Samithi put forward a slew of demands which they wanted to be implemented by the government on a war footing. “We demand the government to complete the seawall work after announcing a deadline. We want the government to construct a groyne along Chellanam coast at the earliest. A vigilance probe has to be initiated into the geotube project. Above all, the government should launch a relief package to reconstruct damaged houses,” said Samithi convener T A Dalphin. Chellanam panchayat president Mercy Joshy said they had apprised the government about the problems through K J Maxi, MLA. Kannamali police registered cases against the protesters for unlawful assembly and blocking road for hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

We aim for quick completion of probe, sa.description: KOCHI: Vigilance and anti-corruption bureau (VACB) inspector general H Venkatesh said the bureau was determined to find the whole gamut of the Palarivattom flyover scam. He added that the investigation was still in its initial stage and that they were in the process of analysing documents in connection with the flyover construction. “The investigation is going on briskly. Routine raids and seizures are happening as part of the probe. The FIR was registered last week we are aiming for a quick completion of the probe,” said Venkatesh. Meanwhile, official sources said the department would scrutinise documents and account details collected during a raid at the contractor’s office and residence. “We are able to get documents from government departments. The raids on Friday was to seize the documents from the private property. All the seized documents would be analysed to find out what all lapses have happened. Role of each individual connected with the construction that has led to a lapse would be brought to the fore through a thorough probe,” said an officer. The raids on Friday started at 3.30pm and continued till 8pm. Two teams of VACB unit conducted raids at the regional office of RDS Project Limited, the New-Delhi based firm that got the contract of constructing Palarivattom flyover, at Panampilly Nagar and an apartment owned by the company MD, Sumit Goyal, at Kakkanad. Details regarding the bank transaction and fund utilized for the flyover construction have been recovered. The flyover has been closed to traffic since May 1 as part of restoration works. \nSpotted Kavya Madhavan at the celebrat.description: Kavya Madhavan dazzled in a black sari at the function held in Trivandrum to mark the completion of 50 years in cinema for Malayalam filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan. At the event the 75-year-old master craftsman was felicitated by his friends from all walks of life. The event was an informal gathering where actress Kavya and Kavya Madhavan shared their experiences working with Adoor. Actors like Madhupal, Manoj K Jayan, Nandu and Manju Pillai were some of the celebs who joined the celebrations, organised by Federation of the Film Societies of India’s Kerala chapter. Monsoon brings back flood fears.description: The monsoon rains that hit Kerala shores after a summer that recorded a temperature rise of nearly 3.9 degree C above normal should have been considered a huge relief for Malayalis. But while many went around romancing the first monsoon showers of the year and clicking selfies, some felt unwelcoming about the rains, and in fact were reduced to anxiety. Research student Sooraj H from Kochi was one such. He had been trapped in Kochi during the unprecedented floods of August and now he can barely look out of the window without feeling restless and breaking into palpitations. For the past two months, he has also been experiencing severe mood swings and sleeplessness and it had begun to affect his work and relationship. Sooraj, who now stays alone in the city, sought help from his friends and explained how his anxiety is affecting his life. “I tried my best to stay calm, but I lost my control when the Orange Alert and low pressure at sea were announced. Also, the video that has been doing the rounds of the flooding at Fort Kochi beach, where I used to hang out, added to my stress,” he says. He approached a psychologist. “I feel much better now as I have understood what is happening to me.” In 2018, Kerala saw its worst monsoon since 1924, as the state’s 44 rivers ran wild, and left over 3.1 lakh homeless; 1,568 relief camps were opened, 432 people died, and several went missing. The Kerala government reported that one-sixth of the state’s population were directly affected by the unexpected natural disaster, causing them mental and physical trauma. As the disaster-affected people in Kerala are trying hard to rebuild their lives, experts say that many are being silently eaten up by the post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), acute stress reaction and acute mental exertion, called anniversary reaction, that could hit one around the time the natural disaster or trauma last struck. According to Dr Vivek Ullattil, a psychiatrist from Ernakulam, over the past two months, most of his cases are related to anxiety stemming from the floods. He points out, “With the start of the monsoon, their anxieties, which were suppressed for a year, are coming out. They are anxious about whether the dams be opened again and if there will be human loss.” His cases, he says, can be categorised into those of people directly affected by the floods, those who have an anxious personality and always consider the worst-case scenario and thirdly, people who have a family history of anxiety disorder or depression. “The monsoon triggers their stress,” he says. Dr Jaico Paulose, who was actively involved in the flood relief activities at Thiruvalla, explains that panic attacks and PTSD affect not just adults, but also children. “The shock is imprinted in children who tend to replay the moments when they had to leave their homes in a hurry due to the waterlogging. It is also very important to address the concerns of children who were trapped inside the house while the water level was rising, as they will be more stressed out.” Pointing to some cases that came to his hospital at Thiruvalla, Jaico says it is essential for the public to have proper awareness on the mental health issues that one can have after being exposed to extreme life events. “In the event of a panic attack, one experiences intense anxiety and accompanied by a rapid heartbeat. So, they quickly head to the cardiologist. Most of the chest discomfort cases we see at our casualty are in fact, just those who suffer panic attacks, which can cause them to feel that they will die right the next moment,” he explains. The levels of stress can be classified into mild, moderate and severe. Mild and moderate stress can be treated through non-pharmacological treatments. Vivek says, “If it is in mild form, one should try to divert their attention by listening to music or taking up an activity or hobby. But if you feel it is going to be difficult to control, you should seek help. Most of the time, minor attacks can be handled by a strong social support system. People who live alone and have no support base will be more prone to panic attacks, so create a strong support system. Everybody becomes anxious and panics in such a situation but when it is excessive and if you feel it is affecting how you live and function, you need to take help.” If it is severe and is affecting their sleep, appetite, relationship and work, they must take counselling or medication. “Many people who come to us feeling mentally disabled, then go on to lead successful lives after identifying their condition as a panic attack. Once they identify this, we teach them to live through the panic attack by prescribing them some relaxation exercises and so on,” says Jaico. But doctors warn against ignoring the symptoms as it may cause major problems. Jaico adds, “Those who have not taken help will avoid going out and prefer to stay inside, as they could be suffering from anticipatory anxiety. They will also confine to their safe zone which is called acrophobic disorder. Once it is cured, they will be free mentally and will be able to face life better.” For children the trauma lingers. Their stress level depends on the reaction of the adults at home. “So, the cure can be done together,” he says. Who is vulnerable to PTSD?1. Those who have been suffering from depression, anxiety disorder, panic disorder or even mood disorder 2. Those who have experienced trauma earlier 3. Those who are mentally vulnerable 4. Depending upon the nature, severity and duration of calamity, people who aren’t suffering the above can also be prone to PTSD SymptomsIf the below symptoms persisting for a month and leads to significant distress and functional impairment, you have PTSD 1. Negative changes in mood and cognition – emotional numbing, shame, guilt, feeling of alienation, inability to recall key details, patchy memory loss, irritability etc 2. Recurrent intrusive memories about the incident or flashback 3. Traumatic nightmares 4. Re-experiencing things you saw or heard during the trauma 5. If you are ignoring people, things and places related to the trauma 6. Alternative arousal and reactivity problems – you may get hyper-aroused or less aroused 7. Some become hyper vigilant, excessively irritable, restless, sleep deprived, disoriented Helpline DISHA 24*7 service- 0471-2552056 Methods to deal with PTSD1.Talk it out 2. Slowly shift to good conversations 3. Exercise 4. Find distractions 5. Find a new hobby 6. Take help if above measures doesn’t work Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Enrica Lexie: Italian marine marries whi.description: KOCHI: Massimiliano Latorre – one of the marines accused in the infamous Enrica Lexie shooting case that resulted in the death of two fishermen off Kerala’s coast in 2012 – married his girlfriend Paola Moschetti Latorre on Saturday. The marriage was held at ‘Church of the Military Ordinariate’ in Rome. After a brain stroke, Latorre was given bail by the Supreme Court of India, which was extended several times upon his application to remain in Italy. At present, the case is being arbitrated at the International Tribunal for Law of the Sea in Germany. Salvatore Girone, the co-accused in the case, was unable to attend the wedding due to the restrictions imposed by the international tribunal. However, he posted a message to Girone on Facebook: “Dear Salvo, today we will not be able to celebrate mine and Paola’s wedding with you, but I assure you that even if you are not physically present, you, Vania, Michele and Martina, will be with us. I hope we can do everything very soon. You and I have lived all our moments and after the tears we now hope the smiles arrive my brother...” On February 15, 2012, two fishermen, Valentine Jalastine and Ajeesh Pink, were shot dead on fishing boat St Antony by Italian oil tanker Enrica Lexie’s guards Latorre and Girone. Italian owners of the tanker had hired them after Savina Caylyn, a sister ship of Enrica Lexie, was captured by Somali pirates in February 2011, while it was on its way to Pasir Gudang in Malaysia with crude oil from Port Bashayer in Sudan. Mexican theatre director Beto Ruiz to he.description: Teachers, artists, aspiring actors, anchors and school-kids got together on Saturday at Riverbourne Centre, Tripunithura, to spend a day with theatre director and trainer Beto Ruiz from Mexico. As the day progressed, most of them, to whom the acting class was a novelty, were fully engrossed in Beto’s engaging conversations and ‘games’. The tips and tricks he shared in the class, according to the participants, were not just lessons in acting, but for life.  “I was super-excited to attend the training ever since I read about him. It was truly worth it. I loved the way he communicated ideas and how he explained to us the importance of knowing one’s own body. Being a college lecturer, it is really important to know how to build a connect with my students and how to transform myself by transforming others,” says Lesly Augustine, assistant professor, Sacred Hearts College, Kochi.  Beto Ruiz Beto, who heads the acting department at the Intercultural Theatre Institute (ITI) in Singapore, has found his third home at Kerala. He, together with a few artistes and art enthusiasts, including koodiyattom performer Kapila Venu, has started a collective in Kerala named Across the River to create international productions. The collective aims at bringing together actors from across the world, including from ITI. “We are creating and devising a new project which is inspired by the works of Arundhati Roy’s God of Small Things and Perumal Murugan’s One Part Woman respectively. We are rehearsing at Irinjalakuda,” says Beto, adding that as an outsider he can view India through new eyes, though he has learnt koodiyattom, kalaripayattu and other art forms of Kerala. “I am focusing more on inter-culturalism with an exchange of ideas, cultures and views with others and seeking people’s responses to the current times. The two books surprised me as I was able to resonate with Mexican social issues while reading it. So, I understood, there is a connection between the two countries; we are not similar, yet we are not totally different.” Talking about the recent workshop, Beto says that he was excited to see that there are so many people at the workshop interested in performing and who aspire to be artistes. “The exchange I have with experienced actors who attend my workshop is fulfilling. The more I do, the more questions I have, be it from books or the conversations. They make the dialogues fresh and make my life productive and healthy. When freshers walk in, I see less ego, less vanity and more energy. An artiste is at first a human and then an artiste, so it will be always good for anybody to be part of acting classes. I see people who get so inspired for life from the games we play. My aim is to create honest performers,” he says. An expert in Kundalini Yoga, Beto picked theatre as a career when he was 15. After completing an undergraduate course in theatre at Guadalajara, Mexico, Beto went to Singapore as he felt there was a need to preserve the holistic approach traditional theatre brings in, where dancers, singers, musicians and actors work together. So, he studied Asian theatre forms and did a theatre training and research programme in Singapore. His prominent works as a director include operas, such as Verdi’s La Traviata and Purcell’s Dido and Aeneas, and plays such as Dario Fo’s Un Dia Cualquiera and Alfred Jarry’s King Ubu. He has also worked on productions in the US, Colombia and Poland. “I was completely trained in realism, as three decades ago, that was the only practice in Mexico. I felt attracted with the mysteries of our body, so I was also trained in contemporary dancing. Then I began doing physical theatre and dance theatre and started exploring its possibilities. At ITI, I found Michel Chekov’s style interesting and that is what I am now working on. I am also following the idea of interdisciplinary practice, using the body in all its possibilities,” he says, adding that the Across the River collective’s project will feature all these ideas. Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more.
