Forest officers return after \u2018raid\.description: IDUKKI/KOCHI: A team of 25 forest officials from Idukki, who had gone for a raid on an illegal sandal distillation facility at Bomma Samudram under Chittoor East forest division in Andhra Pradesh in connection with a sandal smuggling case, went through embarrassing moments when AP forest officials stopped their operation, citing that they did not have the required permission to transport the seized sandalwood out of the state. Following this, around 728kg of sandalwood pieces, from the biggest sandal seizures reported in Andhra Pradesh, had to be handed over to the AP forest officials for safe custody and the Kerala team had to return empty-handed. The officers include Munnar divisional forest officer (DFO) Narendrababu, Marayoor DFO B Ranjit and Marayoor range officer Job J Neriamparampil. According to sources, the team reached Andhra Pradesh on Sunday evening along with Shuhaib alias Kunajappa (36) of Pookkotur in Malappuram, the kingpin of the inter-state smuggling gang, who was arrested on Wednesday night. The operation was part of collecting evidences, based on the information extracted from Shuhaib who had reportedly smuggled more than 20,000kg of sandalwood from Kerala to Andhra Pradesh, of which nearly 10,000kg was sold to the said factory. An officer in the team said they had taken all requisite permission from the state government and given prior intimation to the Andhra forest department while maintaining the confidential nature of the operation. The team, after cordoning off the factory area on Sunday night, started the raid around 5am which continued to till 1pm on Monday. “After the raid, while we were loading the sandalwood pieces on to a truck, AP forest officials arrived in a jeep and told us that we cannot take the items with us until we followed proper legal procedures. After nearly an hour of argument, they took us to the Chittoor East forest division office to talk with the DFO,” he said. The officials were later allowed to return after the Kerala and Andhra forest ministers intervened. The seized sandalwood will be in the Chittoor DFO’s custody until the Kerala team gets legal clearance. The team is currently on its way back to Kerala with the accused. Meanwhile, Ajay Kumar, PRO to the forest minister, said that the entire operation was conducted with full support of AP forest department and there were no issues between officials of two states. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Tunisian film fest to begin today.description: Thrissur: A two-day festival of Tunisian films will begin here on Monday. Six fiction films will be screened at the Kerala Sahithya Akademi Hall as part of the festival. Thrissur Chalachithra Kendram is organizing the festival in collaboration with the Federation of the Film Societies of India (FFSI) and Tunisian Embassy in India.  Tunisian cinema is today recognized as one of the most liberal, imaginative and prize-winning cinemas of the Arab world. The 2011 revolution or the Jasmine Revolution significantly altered the course of Tunisian cinema, giving a boost to the production of documentaries as filmmakers enjoy a much freer environment. Following the revolution, Tunisian cinema experienced a surge in the number of documentaries made compared to fictional films. “The industry has rebounded since the Jasmine Revolution. A dozen feature films are now made each year and new cinemas are opening up. From just a handful cinemas in 2012, the country now has around 15,” said a release issued here on Sunday. ‘Porto Farina’ directed by Ibrahim Letaief , ‘Mostafa Z’, directed by Nidhal Chatta, ‘Shattered Waves’ by Habib Mestiri, ‘Whispering Sands’ by Nacer Khmir, ‘Visit’ (El Ziara) by Nawfel Saheb Ettabaa, and ‘Sweet Smell of Spring’ directed by Ferid Boughedi are the films to be screened as part of the festival. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Unifying school education: Kerala HC sta.description: KOCHI: The Kerala high court on Monday issued a stay on state government’s decision to merge three directorates of school education into one. Justice PV Asha issued a stay for two months after considering during admission hearing a petition (WP-C No. 15937/2019) filed by higher secondary school teacher Saju Mathew of Kadanad in Kottayam and two others. In addition to this petition, Nair Service Society (NSS) and Aided Higher Secondary School Teachers Association have also approached the court. It was alleged in the petition that implementation of the report of the three-member committee headed by MA Khader to unify the three directorates – directorate of public instruction, higher secondary directorate, and vocational higher secondary directorate – goes against the provisions of Kerala Education Rules (KER). The government has issued an order whereby the principal of higher secondary wing has been entrusted with the charge of high school wing. The two wings are separate units and it is not intended in the statute, the petition said. It is pointed out by the petitioners that a higher secondary school teacher (HSST) requires a post graduation whereas a headmaster of a school need not have post graduation. On re-designating the headmaster as principal, he would be intermediate of HSST and principal. Thus, a lesser-qualified person is placed above the HSST, which is against fairness. When a headmaster is re-designated as vice principal, it would create a stalemate in granting promotion to HSST as principal over and above the vice principal. Such a system would create havoc in the realm of school administration, the petition said. In its petition, NSS has alleged that the government’s move goes against Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act (RTE), in addition to Kerala Education Act and KER. The three-member committee went beyond its terms of reference and its recommendation for a monolithic administrative structure goes against RTE’s idea of stand-alone primary and upper primary section with separate administrative setup, NSS has argued. The committee’s recommendation also goes against the principle of decentralization and has proceeded without conducting any empirical study, NSS’ plea had stated. Meanwhile, state government has filed an affidavit stating that it implemented the policy decisions after wide consultations with all stakeholders in the best interest of the public and the student community in general. A principal would hold the charge of all academic and administrative matters of higher secondary section whereas a vice principal will hold the charge of high school section, government said in the affidavit. Its decision to implement the unification in stages is intended to provide a uniform governance structure in all administrative and other matters in a campus having higher secondary school, high school, and vocational higher secondary school, government said, adding that there would be no change in service conditions, monetary benefits, or opportunities of employees. Bharatha Keralam, a confluence of dance.description: A dance event titled Bharatha Keralam featuring bharathanatyam and keralanatanam by young artistes, Kalakshethra Theertha E Poduval and Surabhi Nambisan, was held at Bharath Bhavan in Thiruvananthapuram recently. Accompanied by Bijesh Krishna on vocal, Udaya Sanker Lal on nattuvangam, Kalamandalam Charudutt on mridangam and Suresh Namboothiri on violin, Theertha, an accomplished dancer and teacher in bharathanatyam, weaved aesthetic pieces through her mudras and abhinayas in her hour-long performance. Meanwhile, Surabhi’s graceful performance of Keralanatanam showcased the dance style, which was developed from Kathakali by Guru Gopinath. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nActor Farhaan Faasil sports a stylish.description: While his brother and actor Fahadh Faasil handles a variety of looks with ease, Farhaan Faasil is mostly spotted in his carefree yet cool signature style.  However, at a recent literary event in Kochi, the actor sported a never-seen-much-before whisker and what's more, he carried it off with elan! Farhaan, who has just completed his romcom 'Basheerinte Premalekhanam,' had the company of many renowned directors of Mollywood including his dad Fazil, Siby Malayil, Kamal, Joshiy and Lal Jose.  Meanwhile, Fazil recalled his days and shared vignettes from his life as a director much to the delight of his friends from the film industry. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kerala forest officials detained by Andh.description: KOCHI: A team of seven forest officials from Idukki, who has been conducting a raid in Bomma Samudram in Andhra Pradesh's (AP) Chittoor forest division in connection with a sandal smuggling case on Monday, has been detained by AP forest officials citing that they have not taken any permission from the AP forest department. The team was detained while their way back from the raid at an private, but abandoned, sandalwood factory in Bomma Samudram. Around 728kg of sandalwood pieces, which the Kerala team seized from the sandalwood factory, are also now under AP officials' custody. The detained officers include, divisional forest officers of Munnar, Marayur and Range Officer of Marayur. Munnar DFO Narendrababu, Marayoor DFO B Ranjit and Marayoor range officer Job J Nariamparampil. According to sources, the officials have been set free after confirming their identities, but the seized sandalwood will continue to be in custody of Chittoor DFO (Andhra Pradesh) until the Kerala team gets legal clearance. The team is currently at Chittoor Forest Divisional Office pursuing talks with the DFO to release the seized sandalwood. Meanwhile, Marayur Range Officer Job J Neriamparambil told TOI that they have taken all requisite permission from the Andhra Pradesh government but did not seek AP Forest’s help to keep the secrecy of the operation. “They said that the raid was conducted within Andhra State and hence the seized property belongs to Andhra government. Though they detained us initially, we were released after confirming our identities and ministerial level intervention,” he said. It was on Sunday night the team reached Chittoor based on the information collected from Shohaib (34) alias Kunjappa, who was arrested by the team from Malappuram in connection with sandal smuggling. He had reportedly smuggled more than 10,000kg of sandal from Kerala to Andhra Pradesh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kochi: Next, water transport to go solar.description: KOCHI: After solar-power revolutionized operations of the Cochin International Airport Limited (Cial), it is now the turn of the state water transport department (SWTD) to go eco-friendly with green energy. With the success of the first solar passenger boat, the water transport department is all set to launch three more boats in the coming months. “Aditya, our first solar boat has been running successfully for the last two years and not a trip has been cancelled. The fuel costs have just been Rs 200-280 for electricity and we have saved about Rs 48 lakhs on diesel,” said SWTD director Shaji Nair. Three of the boats including a cruise-liner will become operational in the next few months. The tendering process for the construction of another three boats will begin by the end of this year. Nair said that in contrast to the huge criticism and pressure that the department faced for venturing into solar-powered boats, Aditya is drawing international attention too. “We had senior officials from almost 40 countries visiting us recently to travel in the boat. They were part of the International solar alliance (ISA) and had come to look at the boat so that it could be replicated and customized in their countries,” he said. Of the two new boats under construction at NavAlt, one will be a return boat in the Vaikkom- Thavanakadavu route while the other would be in the Panavally-Thiruvananthapuram route. The cruise-liner will be an air-conditioned, double-decker boat and deployed in Alappuzha for ‘See Kuttanad’ programme. These boats will be powered by a hybrid battery. “During day time, we will use solar power and at night battery power,” Nair said. The first solar boat, Aditya, has completed two years of service in January. During the period, the boat carried 6, 00,000 passengers and travelled around 38,000 km without a single drop of fuel thereby saving 58,000 litres of diesel. This saved Rs 45 lakhs in diesel and maintenance cost during the period. Sandith Thandasherry, the man behind India’s first solar-powered ferry and CEO of NavAlt Solar and Electric Boats said that all countries in the tropical area were interested in the solar boats and the delegation which visited Aditya was in discussions with his company for manufacturing solar boats. He said that the ISA had offered to try to aggregate the combined demand the requirement of the countries as Aditya was a successful model of a public transport with a capacity of carrying 100 passengers. The Inland Waterways Authority of India has also evinced interest in running solar boats in the Ganga and Yamuna. “They have called for tenders for the Yamuna taxi and have kept very high technical standards,” Sandith said. Meanwhile, Kochi Metro’s water project is already looking at solar boats. Also, Cochin International Airport Limited (CIAL) is also looking at a solar-powered boat which is intended to be operated in the inland waterways. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Man held with 2kg hashish oil.description: KOCHI: In a major drug haul, Aluva excise sleuths arrested a 33-year-old man and seized 2kg hashish oil, 95 Alprazolam tablets and 35 Nitrazepam tablets from him. The accused was identified as Zakeer alias Kuruvi Ashru, a resident of Thadakkal near Erattupetta in Kottayam. According to officials, the accused tried to run away when his car was stopped by the shadow team led by Aluva excise inspector T K Gopi near Kalamassery, following which the team chased him down and arrested. Officials said the accused had been selling both drugs in the background of a beauty salon run by him at Perumbavoor. “He was under surveillance after receiving information that he has been smuggling and supplying drugs for night parties. We tracked his vehicle based on the tip-off that he was transporting hashish oil from Thrissur to Ernakulam. The seized contraband, worth Rs 2 crore in international market, is brought from Kulu-Manali region through a Bengaluru-based Iranian,” said an excise officer. The accused allegedly organized drug deals after taking orders through online chatting applications. “We are yet to track his suppliers and passed the information about them to all excise stations. The hashish oil seized from him belongs to ‘green label’ that is considered unadulterated and hence has huge demand in the market,” the official added. A case has been registered under various sections of NDPS Act and the excise officials launched a probe. The accused has been remanded after producing in the court. His car has also been taken into custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\n\u200b Manoj K Jayan rings in the fest.description: A handful of Malayalam celebrities recently gathered to celebrate Onam in advance. But there was more to it, as the event was organised for a noble cause, by the TV actors association, Athma. Among the audience were people affected by paraplegia. Actors Dileep, KPAC Lalitha, Manoj K Jayan and Krishna Prabha, all decked up in Kerala attire, danced and sang with the patients to give them a one -of- a -kind experience. TV host and actor Kishore Sathya and Suby Suresh were also present at the event, which saw an array of programmes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

KSEB to sign power purchase pact with pr.description: KOCHI: The KSEB’s decision to sign power purchase agreement (PPA) with GJ Eco Power Private Limited, which is the private partner of Kochi corporation in constructing Waste to Energy (WtE) plant at Brahmapuram, has kickstarted a row. According to those opposing the sudden decision to sign the PPA, it is unfair from the part of authorities to sign such an agreement when the project has not even received the crucial Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) clearance. As per a communique from KSEB, the power utility will sign the PPA with the private firm in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday. “The PPA should be signed only after the project gets EIA nod. We don’t understand why KSEB is signing the agreement in a hurry,” said Kerala electricity workers federation state secretary Jacob Lazar. “There are many instances in which the KSEB ended up making losses after signing such agreements without considering the consequences. KSEB is still paying fixed charges to National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) though the agency has stopped purchasing power from the Kayamkulam plant. As per the agreement with NTPC, KSEB should pay fixed charges even if it doesn’t purchase electricity from the firm. Similarly, KSEB had to pay fixed charges to a private firm at Eloor despite no electricity was purchased from them,” Lazar said. According to experts in the field of energy and zero waste system, the agreement is being signed in a hurry only to protect the vested interests of certain officials. “The undue haste shown in signing the PPA points to the possibilities of corruption. Breaching the laws first and then getting it rectified has become an order of the day, especially in the case of the state government,” said Zero Waste Systems consultant Shibu K N. “Some of the top officials are behind the move. Their aim is to constitute a waste to energy management authority and place themselves at the top of the body,” Shibu said. Meanwhile, officials with GJ Eco Power Private Limited said the decision to sign the PPA was taken before the general elections. “Just a formal signing of the agreement is happening on Tuesday. There is nothing illegal or unfair in this,” said an official with the firm. “The project would soon get EIA clearance. We have completed the public hearing as part of the EIA clearance. Now, we will be sending the details of the public hearing, including the audio and video clips, to the State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA),” the official said. He also said that approvals from other agencies like Pollution Control Board (PCB) had been secured. “So, the work on the project can be started after securing EIA clearance,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A soothing break was necessary, says cir.description: Kochi: Circle inspector V S Navas, who went incommunicado on Thursday after an argument with a senior officer and returned on Saturday after 44 hours, told reporters that he would act according to the department’s directions. On Friday, Navas’s wife had said that her husband went incommunicado after facing harassment from a senior officer. However, Navas is yet to say anything against his superiors in public on his return. He said that a break was necessary for peace of mind. “When we have troubles, we either cry or will approach someone for comfort or we seek solitude. I wanted some solitude so that I can get relaxed. I have been living mechanically for long. Our soul needs some food, like travel, talking with friends, meeting our Guru, reading good books, listening to music, etc. Some others resort to alcohol or drugs, which I can’t,” Navas told reporters on Sunday.  Navas had gone incommunicado after an argument with ACP P S Suresh. He was transferred to Mattancherry before he went incommunicado, however, sources said that the posting would happen only after the DCP completes the probe and submits a report to the higher ups. “The probe will be conducted by analysing documents and records. We will maintain a status-quo regarding the CI’s posting. He will be meeting the IG on Monday. Senior officers, including the DGP, will take a call on his posting. The newly-appointed CI will take charge at Ernakulam Central while temporary arrangements will be made at Mattancherry,” said a senior officer. Meanwhile, experts said that both officers are likely to face disciplinary action. Officers said that even if there was pressure within the force, officers should be able to withstand them. “Now, the officer concerned is most likely to get a memo for unauthorized absence. What he should have done was to report to his senior, if another officer had used unparliamentary language over the wireless. There would be a recording of it and there would be an action for sure,” said Rtd SP George Joseph. However, officers close to Navas said that he was not someone who bows to pressure. “I know him for years. He has struggled so much over the years. If he wanted to run away, he would have done it much earlier. This means that pressure on him would have been so intense that he would have reached a breaking point,” said an officer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Monsoon advances to northern Kerala.description: KOCHI: It rained in most parts of Kerala and Lakshadweep on Saturday as India meteorological department (IMD) said that conditions had become favourable for the further advancement of southwest monsoon into central Arabian Sea, Karnataka, remaining parts of Tamil Nadu and several parts of northeast India over the next couple of days. IMD warned of rough seas and strong winds (35-45 km/hr) along and off Kerala coast with high waves (2-2.5m) from Pozhiyoor to Kasaragod. There is a possibility that low-lying areas may experience tidal surges intermittently, especially at the time of high tides. Rain was reported at Kozhikode (6cm), Kannur and Vadakara (5cm each), Karipur, Ottappalam, Koyilandy, Vythiri, Irikkur and Kudlu (4cm each). Palakkad, Kollengode, Pattambi, Angadipuram, Thalassery and Perinthalmanna received 3cm each while Chittur, Thrithala, Taliparamba, Mahe (Puducherry UT) got 2cm each. Kayamkulam, Vaikom, Piravom, Myladumpara (Idukki), Kodungallur, Manjeri and Kuppady (Wayanad) received 1cm each. Gale - (110-125 km/hr) too is likely over northeast, northwest and central Arabian Sea. Fishermen are advised not to venture into north and east-central Arabian Sea and along Gujarat coast till June 17. Private agency Skymet Weather said that rain was likely to continue along the west coast with moderate to heavy showers over Konkan and north Kerala. Intermittent rain and thundershowers will continue in Kerala for two more days. It said that the northern limit of monsoon is still passing through northern parts of Kerala. The present synoptic situation shows that conditions are now favourable for further advancement of southwest monsoon, which would cover many parts of coastal Karnataka and adjoining Maharashtra soon. Geotube contractor to move HC.description: KOCHI: The geotube project along Chellanam coast is becoming more controversial as the contractor of the project is about to approach the high court challenging the irrigation department’s decision to terminate the contract. The contractor alleged that the procurement of sand for filling the geotubes was not the part of contract that was entered with the department. “It is the responsibility of the irrigation department to provide the necessary permissions, locate sand and avail sand. The department failed in this, which led to stoppage of the work,” said the contractor. “Irrigation department officials are passing the buck to hide their mistakes. As we had mobilized the manpower, machineries, equipment and geotube materials at site after receiving work order from the department on September 10, 2018, we faced loss of time and money. The scarcity of sand was intimated to the irrigation department several times and dredging is not possible from sea near to the site due to the silt and clay accumulated in the sea up to a greater depth. Availing sand is the prime responsibility of tender issuing department, but now they say that it is the responsibility of the contractor to source sand from anywhere,” said K P Shajeel, supervisor of the project and staff of contractor Mohammed Niyas. Meanwhile, irrigation department executive engineer K Radhakrishnan said that sand was available in the sea and had to be dredged out by the contractor. “The contractor lacks the equipment to dredge out the sand and it is affecting the work which need to be completed at a fast pace. As he failed to meet the tender condition, the department had to initiate termination of contract,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kochi: Power board contract employee ele.description: KOCHI: A contract staff attached to the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) as a lineman was electrocuted while doing maintainence on a damaged electrical post at Kadavanthara on Monday evening. The deceased was identified as Reji Kumar (45) of Valamangalam in Thuravur. The incident happened around 4.45pm near Elamkulam bus stop where he along with his team was working on a damaged post. According to Kadavanthara police, Kumar sustained electric shock after coming in contact with the electric line. Owing to the impact, he was thrown away from the ladder but got trapped on the line. After being alerted, fire officials from Gandhinagar fire station rushed to the spot and brought him down. Though he was rushed to a nearby private hospital by 5pm, he lost his life by 5.30pm. Police said a detailed probe would be launched to know the reason behind the fatal incident. “We are yet to know how it happened and whether the victim had taken any protective measure. A case has been registered for unnatural death under Section 174 of CrPC,” said the police. Ganja peddler arrested Excise sleuths in Perumbavoor on Monday arrested a 32-year-old man on charge of selling ganja. The accused was identified as Gautham Swahin of Kendrapara in Odisha. Officials seized 1.1kg of ganja from the accused who was nabbed from Ponjassery junction near Perumbavoor. According to the officials, the ganja was brought from his hometown. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Project to ensure people\u2019s role in.description: KOCHI: As part of the Indo-German bilateral cooperation, the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) India are jointly implementing Sustainable Urban Development – Smart Cities (SUD-SC) project. The objective of the project is to support sustainable development in various Indian cities. As part of the process, Kochi municipal corporation with the support of GIZ, organized ‘Ente Kochi’ symposium here on Monday. This is to facilitate implementation of sustainable project through a holistic and integrated approach. ‘Ente Kochi’, a participatory planning initiative, involved local residents in participatory processes through an interactive public exhibition set up at the Folklore Cultural Theatre at Fort Kochi. The exhibition had been organized parallel to the Kochi-Muziris Biennale in March. ‘Ente Kochi’ participatory process also spread through the city with a series of neighbourhood workshops at different locations. These neighbourhood consultations, known as ‘Urban Typhoon’ workshops, were held at Kaloor, Edakochi, Elamkulam, Market Canal and Mattancherry in June. These were led by Mumbai-based Urbz, an experimental action and research collective, which specializes in participatory planning and designing, and has experience working in India and other international locations. At the same time, there are opinions that this programme does not have much significance in states like Kerala. “We have people’s planning programme which ensures people’s participation in designing and implementation of development projects in an effective manner. So, the initiative by GIZ has nothing more to do,” said an official with the Kochi corporation said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Palarivattom flyover closure puts safety.description: KOCHI: The safety of the bridges in Kochi has come under lens after structural damages were reported on the Palarivattom flyover. There are more than 20 major bridges built across waterbodies in and around Kochi city bearing the entire load of traffic. Kochi, one of the cities with highest traffic density in the state, saw a growth of registered vehicles from 22,163 in 2009 to 31,111 in 2018. Apart from these vehicles registered in Ernakulam, vehicles from other districts as well as states pass through the commercial capital of Kerala every day. However, these bridges saw little maintenance over the years. S Shaheem, director incharge of National Transportation Planning and Research Centre (Natpac), said regular maintenance of bridges is mandatory to meet the pressure of increasing vehicular movement. “The public works department (PWD) is bound to ensure that contractors undertake periodical maintenance work without fail,” he said. Shaheem said the department has the responsibility to include necessary clauses in the contract which facilitates maintenance works by a contractor for a specified period of time. V K Jayadevan, a former official in Kerala Engineering Research Institute, said bearings and road toppings need frequent upkeep. “The concrete mix used for road works should be tested during the construction to ensure that the bridge or the road meet its strength as per the design,” he said. Officials with PWD said bridges are designed after taking into consideration “anticipated vehicle movement”. An official with PWD quality control wing said bridges should stand at least for a minimum of 100 years. “Bridges have to be built as per the standards stated in Indian Road Congress (IRC). The bridges are to be designed only after assessing the intensity of vehiclular movement through the road where it is being planned to come up,” she said. Officials in the design wing of PWD said bearings in bridges that see high vehicular movement will have to be replaced within 30 years. “Earlier bridges were constructed under 70 R Loading. When heavy vehicles pass through these bridges, it jerks. In such cases, we install warning boards near the bridge. Now, we construct bridges following the guidelines of IRC,” an official said. A former Natpac official said the contractor should construct the bridge linking the number of vehicles plying on it and the load the bridge has to bear. “The width of the bridge is decided based on the number of vehicles that will have to ply on it once the construction is completed. The super structure is constructed after studying the load the bridge has to carry. Wind force in the area should also be considered to ensure the strength of the bridge,” said T Elangovan, former director of Natpac. PWD minister K Sudhakaran said the state government has conducted audit of bridges across the state. “After the bridge at Enath in Pathanamthitta developed cracks, we conducted a study to assess the condition of bridges in the state. On the basis of the study, we categorised around 3,000 bridges into three: ones that need to be pulled down and reconstructed, to be repaired, and those are in good condition,” Sudhakaran said. “We are reconstructing or repairing the bridges on a priority basis,” he said. Childline rescues five more children.description: KOCHI: Childline intervened for the rescue of five more children trafficked through Aluva railway station on Saturday. With this, Childline rescued 27 children, all boys, since the setting of the helpdesk at Aluva railway station on Monday. Childline has asked the state government to set up a permanent shelter home for boys in Kochi. “Of the 27 children, four are from Kerala and the remaining are from other states. Eleven children from north India were sent back home with their parents and relatives. Of the remaining 12 children, five have been moved to temporary shelter Snehakoodu at Aluva and five at Galilee at Karukutty. The remaining two children are temporarily sheltered at Don Bosco’s Snehabhavan at Palluruthy. One child, who is at Galilee, will be sent with his mother on Sunday,” said Childline director Fr Jensen Variyath. “All of them had fake identify cards. We have sought an inquiry into fake identity cards and the racket involved in trafficking children from north and northeastern states,” said Fr Variyath. Currently, there is no government-run home for boys in the city. There is only a government run-home for girls at Kakkanad. “We have asked the state government to set up a government-run home for boys in the city. In addition, we have requested the government to set up a permanent child helpdesk at Aluva railway station, which is a transit point for trafficking of children for child labour and other purposes,” he said, adding that the Childline helpdesk at the railway station was set up only for a week. Akademi unlikely to revoke award.description: Thrissur: Kerala Lalithakala Akademi is unlikely to yield to the diktats of the ruling and opposition combine to withdraw the award given to the cartoon on Bishop Franco Mulakkal, who is accused in a rape case. Akademi chairman Nemom Pushparaj is learned to have taken the stance that the declared award would not be withdrawn. According to sources close to Pushparaj, he would not continue as chairman if the government insists that the award should be withdrawn. Akademi executive and general council will hold a special meeting on Monday to review the decision, as suggested by the government in the backdrop of the allegation that the artwork hurts religious sentiments. The same jury may be asked to review it. However, a review need not mean that the award would be withdrawn, Akademi officials clarified. The cartoon portrayed the bishop flaunting an under garment on the pastoral staff (bishop’s crozier). Akademi officials argued that crozier as well as mitre was not religious icons, but only part of the symbols that show the bishop’s authority. Akademi secretary Ponniam Chandran had received a threat to life over phone following the award declaration. Cyber police is investigating the incident.  On whether the move to withdraw the award would mean the Akademi was succumbing to such threats, Chandran said, “There is no question of succumbing to pressures and threats. If we do this, then it will set a precedence and more people will resort to such tactics.’’ Meanwhile, K K Subash, the creator of the cartoon, has written a letter to the Akademi chairman refuting the allegation that he added religious symbols in the cartoon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nature lover Byju Vasudevan passes away.description: Thrissur: Environmentalist and birdwatcher Byju K Vasudevan died at a private hospital here on Sunday. He was 43. Byju, who had participated in several agitations, including the protest against proposed power station at Athirappilli, had been undergoing treatment for injuries sustained in a fall. He is survived by wife and three children. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Court stays Jose\u2019s elevation as cha.description: IDUKKI: Thodupuzha munsiff court has stayed the election of Jose K Mani as the chairman of the Kerala Congress (Mani) on Monday. The court refrained Jose from officiating the duty of the party chairman and holding the elections in the party, said the counsel of KC (M) state committee members Philip Stephen and Manohar Naduvilethu who petitioned against Jose. The order is not out yet. Jose was elected in a state committee meet held in Kottayam on Sunday. Meanwhile, Jose arrived at the party headquarters in Kottayam by evening. The name board of K M Mani outside the room of the chairman was removed and a new board with Jose 's name was fixed. Jose spent some time in the chairman's room. Before leaving he told reporters that he did not receive a copy of the order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Unifying school education: HC stays stat.description: KOCHI: The Kerala high court on Monday issued a stay on state government's decision to merge three directorates of school education into one. A stay was issued by the court after considering petitions challenging implementation of the report of a three-member committee headed by MA Khader that recommended for a unified directorate of education at the school level and creation of the post of director general of education by unifying the three directorates – directorate of public instruction, higher secondary directorate, and vocational higher secondary directorate. It was alleged by the petitioners that the government's move would give the charge of principal of higher secondary school to headmaster of high school. As headmasters need not have post graduation and higher secondary school teachers need post graduation, it would result in placing a head master over higher secondary school teachers. Nair Service Society (NSS), which runs many schools in the state, had also questioned implementation of the commission report before the high court. It was alleged by NSS that the orders issued by the government are contrary to Kerala Education Act and its rules as well as provisions of Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act (RTE) and its rules. The government’s move also hinders the time-tested public education system that has separate administrative setup as well as teaching and non-teaching staff with qualifications befitting the physical and mental growth of children, NSS had contended.
